intro: Roettlera limans, commonly known as the narrow-leaved roettlera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are elongated and lance-shaped, often with a distinct, fragrant scent. The small, white or greenish flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family.
